Retrenchment benefits are based entirely in the employment contract. If it is not there, it is then left entirely to the goodwill of the employer. If the retrenchment is due to resizing or due to a merger and if retrenchment benefits are negotiated with the incoming shareholder, retrenchment benefits could be given as a goodwill. Otherwise strictly following the employment contract, you may get nothing. Why some NMCs give retrenchment benefits is because they have these terms in their standard employment contracts.
